content.text:
Take Me Home, Country Roads
by John Denver

Capo 2 


[Verse]
[ch]G[/ch]               [ch]Em[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]                     [ch]C[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]
Almost Heaven, West Virginia, Blue Ridge Mountains, Shenandoah River.
[ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]Em[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]                           [ch]C[/ch]
Life is old there, older than the trees, younger than the mountains, blowin 
         [ch]G[/ch]
like a breeze.

[Chorus]
       [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D7[/ch]         [ch]Em[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]
Country Roads, take me home, to the place I belong
         [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]
West Virginia, mountain mama, take me home, country roads.

[Verse 2]
[ch]G[/ch]                [ch]Em[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
 All my memories gather round her, miner's lady, stranger to blue 
[ch]G[/ch]
water.
[ch]G[/ch]                [ch]Em[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]                         [ch]C[/ch]
Dark and dusty, painted on the sky, misty taste of moonshine, teardrop in my 
 [ch]G[/ch]
